description: From Middle English bakbiten, bacbiten, equivalent to back- +‎ bite. Cognate with Icelandic bakbíta (“to backbite, vilify”).

entries.meaning: One who engages in backbiting; a backbiter.

verbs.description: backbite (third-person singular simple present backbites, present participle backbiting, simple past backbit, past participle backbitten)

entries.meaning: To make spiteful slanderous or defamatory statements about someone.
(informal) To attack from behind or when out of earshot with spiteful or defamatory remarks.
To speak badly of an absent individual.
